google_reviews.author: Brock McDaniel
google_reviews.review: Take the reviews into serious consideration before renting from PTLA.  I can honestly say, only rent from them if you have absolutely have no other choice.  I knew going in it wouldn't be a great experience...but didn't expect it to be as bad as my experience was. Now of course, they manage many different properties all over the county so they differ from location to location... but the blatant neglect of the new building I lived in, not giving me any other option to relocate when they were dealing with drugs/homeless living in and intruding the building, theft/vandalism... I actually questioned the humanity of the employees they had working for them, I truly don't understand how they treat tenants the way they do and go home to their kids and sleep at night.  I got my final move out and just like another recent review, they'll rake you for everything they can... they charged me for lightbulbs and smoke detector (I replaced lightbulbs in the place on my dime during my time there and the smoke detector was fine, actually tested earlier in the year when they did building inspections.) I am so relieved to not be under PTLA anymore, good riddance. Stay far away from them.

google_reviews.author: kat
google_reviews.review: Absolutely horrible. Paying full rent for living in a construction zone and kids being booted from their apartments for days. Contacted- fire inspector, local tenant right groups. Reported to the head of student affairs WWU offsite housing office who had the U listed as an apartment option. Had to pay for parking for a year due to all the spots taken due to construction. Do not rent from this group, slum loads at best.

google_reviews.author: Susanna Dupont
google_reviews.review: Trying to pay my rent on time. No heat in my apartment for six months. Doors fall off. Bike stolen. Feeling frustrated. Dealt with them in past nothing good to say. Invasion of privacy homelessness. Know the law.

google_reviews.author: Mitch B
google_reviews.review: Don't expect to get any damage deposit back. In fact i got a bill for $651 and lost the $750 damage deposit. I know what the place looked like when i left and it did not have that much damage. Be very aware. Take video of EVERYTHING before you move in.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. We document the reasons for our move-out charges with video and photo, and we would be happy to review these with you if you feel you have been charged in error. Please reach out to us at your convenience to discuss.

google_reviews.author: Josephine Bloom
google_reviews.review:
I have had multiple problems with this management only over the span of 6th months:

Move in:
- We were supposed to move in September 1st. We got an email the day before that nobody will be working Saturday September 1st through Tuesday September 2nd, due to Labor Day. We called and called explaining that all of our things are already packed and ready for move in tomorrow and they just kept telling us that we couldn't until the 3rd. We finally got in contact with someone who worked with us and we moved in as planned.

- PTLA left a notice on our door that one of my roommates didn't pay rent. She paid 2 days before we received the notice. The money was taken out of her account and the payment bounced on their end. My roommate called and the people she talked to were vague and said that they would take care of it. 5 days go by and a late fee was initiated. She called again to receive the same answer as before. She got an email later saying they resolved it and took no fault.

Parking and management attitude:
- Day of move in we were given our assigned parking. One of the spots does not exist. I was told just to park in the 15-minute spot by the person who worked with us to get our move in date situated. Few days later building receives an email that no one can park there. I called and left voicemails with no response. I had to catch a manager on site (don't count on them being there during the time on the office hours sheet) and they walked me through all lots and pointed at the "guest spots" that I could park in.
I continue to park in the spots she indicated and get back from school to my car being towed. Costed $546 plus the money I lost from having to call out of work. I call and go into the office and explained my situation with parking since move in. She continues to interrupt and tell me I need to be parking in my assigned spot, the one that doesn't exist. She pulled out a list of all the parking spots and which apartment they belong to and tells me that spot is there because she walked the lots and took note of them. I take a video of the lot, showing that spot isn't there, come back and show them and again take no fault. They continue to tell me I was parked in an assigned spot and that I didn't have it in writing that I was told I could park there.

Overall:
I do not recommend leasing with this management. Managers were condescending, interruptive, and rude. No emails or voicemails responded to, not on site when they tell us they're supposed to. I will not be leasing with them again.

google_reviews.author: Eric Oliver
google_reviews.review: Rented from them for 2 years, then cleaned my appartment thoroughly.  I rented a carpet cleaner, dusted all light fixtures, sprayed and wiped down every inch of that appartment and back porch.  It was emaculate.  Never got my deposit back and was hit with a cleaning fee after it was all said and done.  No explanation or anything.  When they're done with you expect to get screwed.  I've lived a lot of places and had only positive experiences to this point.  Please listen to all these reviews and don't give them your business.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. We are always happy to discuss move out charges if any resident believes they were charged incorrectly upon move out. Please reach out to us if you believe there has been an error.

google_reviews.author: Paige Vinton
google_reviews.review: I rented from PTLA for a little over a year and didnt have a good experience overall. Shortly after moving in, I received a notice on my door that I hadnt paid rent. I had paid before I moved in. I tried contacting the office for two days, left multiple messages, and no one returned my call. I had to go into the office to talk with somewhere where I was treated rudely and had to tell the staff to stop treating me like they were. I did end up sitting down with the head manager at the time and she worked through the situation with me. From my experience, people dont return your call and you have to physically go into the office if you need any type of response you cant get from the on-site manager (if there is one) at your property. Overall, I didnt have a good experience working with the staff and management at this company and would not recommend renting from them.

owner_response.text: We are sorry to hear that you had difficulty getting in touch with our team. We are constantly making changes to improve our service, and we take our residents' feedback into consideration, so we appreciate you leaving us a review. If there is anything we can do to assist you at this time, please do not hesitate to reach out.

google_reviews.author: Ashleigh Voss
google_reviews.review: This company's employees were very respectful and helpful to me and I hope they get more business. They helped me get an apartment in a very difficult renting climate in Whatcom county. They handled a difficult situation with dignity that necessitated immediate move out without charging unfair fees. I am happy with their professionalism. From the moment I applied to the moment I moved out, they were there for me every step of the way and actually returned calls in a timely manner. Julian was the BEST! Thank you guys for everything you did for me. I would love to rent from you again if I ever move back to the area.

owner_response.text: Thanks for your feedback, Ashleigh! We're so glad to hear our team was helpful through your renting journey. We'd love to rent to you again should you find yourself back in town!

google_reviews.author: Ally Carter
google_reviews.review: Ive only been renting from PTLA for a few months but theyve been an absolutely horrible last few months. Maintenance requests have been ignored and payments have not been communicated about properly. This is a company taking advantage of the student population in Bellingham and subjecting them to their poor management and communication skills.

owner_response.text: Ally, we're concerned to read your feedback and would love the opportunity to speak with you so we can improve our services. Please give us a call at your earliest convenience.

google_reviews.author: nancy irwin
google_reviews.review: As a parent to one of the residents at The U Apartments, I wish I could rate this as a zero. We did a tour of the U in Feb 2024. The apartment walkways had 4 x4s supporting the walkways. We met with one of the management people there, who forgot that we had an tour appointment. We asked about the supports and she said that PTLA took over the property in late 2023 and the inspectors pointed out that the walkways needed to be fixed and PTLA has plans to fix it during the summer, before fall quarter starts. The boys agreed to sign the lease. Since March till Sept 2024, I've been communicating with PLTA with questions and about if the construction is still on schedule for the summer. I kept getting mixed answers. Some said there were no plans and others said that they didn't know. Fast forward to move in date, Sept 2024. Construction started not too long ago. It was difficult to move since there were rafters everywhere. My son's room, which is the smallest, one of the windows had plastic over it. The closet door was off it's track. It looked like it has been like that for a while. Appliances are old. They had a long list of damaged items for their damage list. The construction noise was unbearable, especially when they start at 8:00 am. And very inconvenient to work around the many notices to enter, which majority of the time, they didn't enter till the last day. The first weekend they spent there, someone pulled the fire alarm at 2:30 am and all the residents evacuated. It was raining really hard and they couldn't get back into the apartment until the fire department got a hold of PTLA, which took about 30 mins after the fire department took 15 minutes to get there. I can't image if it was a real fire, the place would of burned quickly with all the plywood and construction equipment in the front parking lot, the fire trucks would have a difficult time fighting it. There would be no way for the residents on upper floors to escape. PLTA seems to have an "I don't know" attitude when it comes to answers or maintenance requests, which there were many in the two months they have been living there. It's very frustrating dealing with them, even as a parent. Maybe their other properties is 1/2 a step above The U Apartments. But they should have not let people move in with all the construction chaos and broken or falling apart things at The U. It's ridiculous. Not even the Corporate offices has contacted me after emailing them. All they care is making over $3,275 per month, not including utilities for a run down 4 bedroom apartment.

google_reviews.author: lauren swangler
google_reviews.review: Moved in with my two roomates this month. On arrival we saw the construction with no prior warning, except a $250 gift card with minimal context concerning construction. The only stairs we were able to use the first two weeks and for move in were scaffolding. September 20 at 10:30 am with no warning from management both me and my roomates windows were removed while we were in our rooms. Since our windows were removed they have not been fully reset back into the wall allowing for the construction noises to be noticeably louder than before starting at 8am. The week after we were sent emails and flyers about removing our windows the following day and being legally obligated to inform us when they had not previously. Last Friday two hours after the management office closed we were informed if we needed to leave our apartment Monday through Wednesday between the hours of 8am to 5pm we would not be able to unless we left at 8am and were gone until 5pm. We have not been able to contact the office as they send every call straight to voicemail and when they do pick up they send you on a wild goose chase to the next phone number.

google_reviews.author: G
google_reviews.review:
Absolutely terrible. A neighbor was doing renovation work and blasting music late at night over a period of months; all PTLA had to do was send an email to the condo manager and they would deal with the issue, but instead PTLA kept saying "we'll get back to you" and never did. I was forced to move and I'm so grateful that I have a friendly, responsive landlord now, and not a parasite like PTLA. You've been warned.

Update: PTLA's response says to give their office a call. They never returned any of my phone calls when I was renting from them.

owner_response.text: We're sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience with our team. We're passing along your feedback to our management team to help us improve our services. If there is anything we can do to assist you at this time, please feel free to give our office a call.

google_reviews.author: David E
google_reviews.review:
Ive had thirty-one years of experience as a renter. Judging by the reviews on this site and the one before it when PTLA took over from APEX, many people have had bad experiences with this company. However, in leaving a review, I have to go by my own experience, and in general my wife and I had a comparatively decent one with PTLA.

On the downside, I did not appreciate the fifty-eight page lease designed, above all else, to protect the legal interests of PTLA and building owner. I also didnt like the background check and the disclosure of personal information. Move-in did not go as smoothly as I hoped because the elevator was out, and there was no hope of getting it fixed before the movers arrived that day. Finally, we found the apartment had a number of functional problems when we moved in: one faucet in the bathroom tub didnt work; one set of blinds were stuck in the up position; a bathroom fan was broken; a garage door opener didnt work; and a toilet didnt work properly and didnt have a safety shut-off valve.

On the upside, we found that the PTLA maintenance team responded quickly, and all problems were fixed in a reasonable amount of time. This was true of subsequent problems, as when the garage door became stuck when someone hit it with their vehicle. My recommendation is that tenants submit maintenance requests through the portal and attach photographs. That worked for us.

Although the lease was long, it also made it pretty clear that tenants were not allowed to create noise disturbances. In general, the building was adequately managed, though the grounds were littered with trash which no one ever bothered to attend to.

Move-out went smoothly. We were leveled relatively small charges for minor cleaning and painting, and as a result we received most of our deposit back. This seemed fair to us. We also werent charged for carpet cleaning because we left the carpet in good condition. This was also fair.

In general, there is room for improvement in PTLAs management, and I hope this review is seen as constructive. If youre planning to rent in Bellingham, you should look around and consider your options. PTLA, in our experience, is a reasonable option.

owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing this feedback, David. We are sorry to hear about the troubles you experienced upon move in. We appreciate your thoughtful response and are always looking for ways to improve. These will certainly be taken into consideration.

google_reviews.author: Trevor M
google_reviews.review:
Oh look, they made a new Google account to get rid of all their 1 star reviews! Perfect, I'll just copy and paste from my last 1 star review....

Spend your money elsewhere... We moved into the brand new Crescent building that had and still has more issues than they know what to do with. If you can even get a hold of someone in their office they'll just play dumb and act sorry. Maintenance issues do not get addressed. Take your money elsewhere. They were and are not willing to work with us when we had unexpected life-issues come up forcing us to move, they just care about getting their overpriced rent. Maintenance and snow removal are non existent, this past snow storm the sidewalks and parking spaces weren't touched. Sidewalks were not walkable, and the front door doesn't open so tenants were supposed to walk around the building on ice-covered sidewalks to get inside. One of the two elevators has been broken 6 of the 8 months we've lived here. Heating systems inside units aren't able to keep up, and they won't heat or fix the heat in the buildings hallways and common areas so our electric heat has to run 24/7. The units do not get warmer than 60 degrees. The "Leasing agent", Kylie, lied upon move in claiming the units have A/C. They do not. My fault for not checking, I guess I should have known I was being lied to. Winter temps are no warmer than 60 inside while summer temps are 90+ on the 5th floor. I guess I had decent expectations for almost $2000 a month  The grass was never cut in the summer, and poison plants were found around the building that are fatal for dogs. This once again was not taken care of. The walls are very poorly soundproofed so noise and music from neighbors goes right thru falls.

UPDATE 01/06/2023
PTLA HAS NOT reached out, instead someone got upset that the front door has been faulty for quite some time now, forcing everyone to walk around. The only handicapped door that is. And now someone ripped the door handle off. Id imagine this will take months for them to fix as well. Once again, do not rent here.

Update 01/30/23
The streetlights and exterior walkway lights have been out for over a week now. You can hardly see anything in the parking lot or behind the building, must walk with a flashlight. Just a matter of time before all the local Bellingham tweekers that live in the woods next to the building come out and start smashing into car windows to steal stuff now that they dont have to worry about streetlights. Have to assume PTLA just hasnt paid the bill, theyre cheap (obviously).

google_reviews.author: sel gilber
google_reviews.review: This is the worst property management company Ive rented from in Bellingham. Ive had positive experiences with Landmark, , Local Property Management and a couple smaller companies. PTLA purchased my property recently and Ive had nothing but issues. They wont take off additional charges for renters insurance when I have proof of my own that Ive had since before they took over and a huge lack of follow through. I accidentally locked myself out with my dog and laundry and they made me call a locksmith on a Saturday morning. The only locksmith that answered didnt want to help because I live in an  apartment and the landlord should unlock the door for me. (Agreed) Luckily, after some convincing he was willing to help. If you have options do not rent from them.

google_reviews.author: Dana Huggett
google_reviews.review: I have been trying for days to get in touch with anyone in the office. Our hot water froze during the last cold snap and because of a design flaw the pipes ran in an exterior wall. The only solution was to put a small heater in the garage and it took 3 days for the weather to warm up and the pipes to thaw. By law they have 24hrs to find a solution. Secondly, I live in a 3 story townhome with the lower level consisting of a bedroom/bathroom and entry way. On a normal winter day the temperature cannot get above 62 degrees with full heat going. When it was cold outside it was 48 degrees on that level, I had to move my daughter out of her room and upstairs. On the upper 2 floors the the heat also struggled in the cold with the max heat being 62 on the very cold days. In speaking with others in the same type of unit in my complex they are also having the same difficulties with heat. This is a design flaw and cannot be rectified easily. PTLA has violated the tenancy law but not rectifying the situation in a timely manner. I have put in my notice to terminate my tenancy after 3 days of no hot water/adequate heat and have not heard anything from them. I have emailed, dropped off a letter, messaged through the portal and called and left a message. Not sure what else to do.

owner_response.text: Dana, thank you for reaching out, and we apologize for the delayed response. A member of our team will reach out to you today to address these concerns.

google_reviews.author: Charles
google_reviews.review:
Terrible, cant contact and wont help anything.
Theyll finally start looking into your issues once you complain in person. I could update this more but long story short they suck especially if you are a young person.
If youre going to college DEFINITELY do not consider this company, thankfully Im not but am a young adult and they are terrible. Wont assist anything and just try to maximize the money and pain they can take and give to you

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear that you haven't been pleased with your experience with us. We would be happy to discuss your concerns with you. Feel free to reach out to us at your earliest convenience.

google_reviews.author: Gabby Cagley
google_reviews.review: One of the most inept management groups in bellingham for renters. Our pipes froze this winter at no fault of our own and they never followed up. They continue to add on new charges to nickel and dime renters whenever they feel like it and consistently raise rent without any improvements to the apartment or a real reason other than the market. They send a pay up or get out eviction notice after being late one time on payment over the course of multiple years of residence over a simple clerical error with no contact follow up or phone call to perhaps check on why rent was late. Ive lived at one of their rentals for almost three years and this is kind of treatment Ive received. They do not care about residents. I wish I had not resigned my lease and looked elsewhere. Not worth it at all.

google_reviews.author: Rylee Andrews
google_reviews.review: I tried taking a lease over and they made the entire process extremely difficult. I was sent on a wild goose chase, applying to various links that were sent and in the end they told me that it was too late to take over the lease even though I have been trying to for over two months in which I had to apply to another link to get an apartment. The entire process was extremely misleading and unhelpful. The lack of structure is extremely disappointing, also when calling only one person knows the leasing information but is never there.

google_reviews.author: Kim Meza
google_reviews.review: PTLA has been great so far. Im new to renting from this property management and they have been great with communication! Quick to return calls, emails, viewing properties, etc. The first apartment I looked at wasnt what I needed and my rep (I want to say Jordan?!?!?) was quick to show me alternative locations. I would recommend.

owner_response.text: Thanks for your review! We're so glad you've been pleased with your experience so far. If anything comes up that we can help with, please let us know!

google_reviews.author: Salim
google_reviews.review: Ive been here for 2 months, and I have nothing good to say about PTLA. For starters, the entire apartment was much smaller than advertised on the floor plan. About 2 square feet per room smaller. The washing machines went out for a week, and they did nothing to respond to our calls and emails, so we just had to wear dirty clothes. They didnt charge us for electricity until this month, when they dropped the 2 months of electricity bills on us at once, AFTER our rent had already been paid, then continued to charge us $5 per day of late fees without notifying us. We didnt notice this until it racked up to over $50. Then, of course, theyve continued to not respond to our emails or calls, and continually go out of office for extended periods of time. They are raising the rent, and making us sign the lease for next year in December. If we dont by the 8th, they are going to raise it again. If we don't by the end of the month, they will assume we arent renewing?? PTLA is an awful, selfish, money hungry business. Never trust them.

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback, and we're sorry to hear that you have not had a good experience so far. Unfortunately, the laundry machines at your property are owned and managed by a third-party laundry company who will not allow us to do maintenance on the machines ourselves. However, if you ever have issues with the machines, you can contact their  customer support. We have signs in the laundry rooms with their contact information should you ever need assistance. 
We did have an issue with the utilities charges this month, which has now been resolved. We are happy to reverse any late fees that were assessed because of this error if your account is otherwise in good standing. It looks like our team already took care of this for you, so please reach out to us if you do not see that on your account. 

Thank you for your understanding, and we look forward to improving your experience.

google_reviews.author: Callie L
google_reviews.review: Tried to steal our entire security deposit after move out when we spent 2 full days with 6 people cleaning the apartment. I anticipated they might try this so I took a video upon move out to prove the state of the apartment was perfectly clean and in good order. It took the video proof, a lawyer, and calls and emails every single day to get them to return the deposit. If you must rent from them, take pictures/videos on move in and move out and be prepared to contact them every single day when they steal your deposit. Also CC their bosses on the emails so they get annoyed/embarrassed and respond back to you. Good luck and rent elsewhere if possible!!

owner_response.text: Callie, thank you for your review. We apologize for the responsiveness issues you experienced. Although we do our best to fairly assess move-out conditions, we welcome former residents to reach out to us if they feel we have made a mistake so we can correct that. We are glad to have resolved your concern and are working to improve future responsiveness. Again, thank you for your review, and we are happy to speak with you if there is anything further we can do for you.

google_reviews.author: Yost
google_reviews.review: Dont rent from them if you can avoid it. There was hundreds of 1 star reviews, all of a sudden, theyre gone. Absolutely terrible and garbage property management office. I have no qualms with maintenance. They respond quick and do what needs to be done. But the office took 6 months to process an application for your roommate. I started that process in January, my lease was up for renewal in May. May comes around, 3 days before the deadline for my lease renewal, they tell me my roommate isnt qualified. Ive live here 7 years and havent missed a month, and my past roommates had been even less qualified, so it made no sense. But, they waited till 3 days before my lease renewal deadline to say something, and then refused to give me an extension on that lease renewal timeline. I even pointed out to them that it took them 6 months to process the application. Another time I went into the office to pay my rent in person, they failed to tell me then that other one time fees had been added to my rent and that the check I was giving them would not suffice. I have a list of complaints, I dont want to fill up the whole review area lol

google_reviews.author: Herobrine
google_reviews.review: They'll take 3/4 of your deposit. Don't bother paying cleaners because they will charge you the maximum allowed cleaning fee anyway. They are dishonest.

google_reviews.author: Matthew Schnell
google_reviews.review:
1. PTLA is difficult to contact. Plan to go directly to the office if you need to talk with anyone.  I had days where I called up to 6 times with no response or reply to voicemail or email. The property manager where I lived also rarely answered or returned calls.
2. My unit was brand new when we started the rental.  The unit was covered in construction dust and had clearly not been cleaned.  We even found a doorstop in the freezer.
3.  PTLA billed me for over 4 hours of cleaning (in addition to the carpet cleaning I had agreed to in the lease).  I sent PTLA multiple pictures of the clean apartment asking what the fee was for and noting that PTLA postmarked my refund over the time allowed by law.  PTLA then refunded the remainder of my deposit.

If renting with PTLA, I suggest documenting everything very thoroughly.  Take excessive photos, videos and follow up on phone calls via email.

Also, note that the reviews now only show as going back to Summer of 2023.  The old reviews are now missing.

google_reviews.author: Megan Raetz
google_reviews.review:
PTLA is very difficult to get a hold of and has gone thru at least three community managers for Meadows at June Rd during the last six months. The parking at this property is atrocious and after moving in, they decided to change our assigned parking spot to one that doesnt even fit our stock F150. After three months of being told they will work to find us a new spot, they now refuse to help. The on site garbage bin areas are filled with trash daily and trash all over the ground. Its very clear there has not been a community manager capable of running this property for some time now.

Do not recommend.

google_reviews.author: Maya Williams
google_reviews.review:
Do not rent from PTLA!!! They managed to remove all old reviews (pretty suspicious since most were 1-2 stars). I have had to deal with them at two separate properties and they have been difficult the entire time.
Belvedere - they used the age of the building to excuse poor maintenance. There was mold, fleas, the windows leaked, the basement flooded multiple times, washers backed up with black fluid, and there were three seperate gas leaks when I moved out. Maintenance requests were slow and as soon as you asked for something more than the bare minimum they stopped responding.
Elwood edge - when owership transferred PTLA lost my rent payments and proof of insurance and then tried to EVICT ME. This was after I notified them of the fact that a payment wasn't applied to my account. They stopped responding to my calls and emails after the eviction notice without notifying me that they had stopped proceeding with the eviction.

Please stay away from them! They do not care about you

google_reviews.author: Lindsey Hanna
google_reviews.review: Awful customer service. Terrible response time for maintenance issues. basically cannot get anyone to respond to an email or phone call and if they do they usually mess it up. They have VERY sneaky wording in their lease renewals so watch out! They send out renewal contracts six months in advanced with decent deals so just be aware cause if you ignore those you will lose you place at the end of your lease. In regards to the actual unit at Elwood. Its beautiful. Marble counters, stainless steel appliances and in unit washer/dryer. The construction is near finished so you dont hear it that often anymore. Parking sucks but thats typical for Bellingham.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your review, Lindsey. We are sorry to hear you haven't had a positive experience so far. A member of our team will reach out to you shortly to address your concerns.

google_reviews.author: Corie Odenbreit
google_reviews.review: Pretty telling when all the reviews from before 2023 have been removed. They deleted my review from a year ago but thats ok Ill just keep posting one. Terrible place to rent from, Monterra Apartments are in a disgusting state and probably should be torn down. Terrible rental prices for barley any amenities. Staff is unresponsive and rude. My partner could over hear one of the office managers talking bad about us through the walls and she referred to my partner as a b!tch. Mind you, we went to their office to ask what was going on after not finishing any repairs on our cracked and leaking ceiling. Avoid at all cost, especially young students moving to the area.

google_reviews.author: Terry B
google_reviews.review: Nearly impossible to get a hold of when you need to. The unit I was put into first smelled like the person renting it BATHED in w3ed, despite the lease clearly stating that ANY drug--and literally calling out this one!--is a violation of the lease and cause for revocation of your security deposit. It took a new company coming in, 10 weeks after my "allowed" unit change date before I finally got into another unit - and I was still paying for the druggie den! Thankfully the new company acknowledged that PTLA is full of lazy @$$h0les and waived the $250 fee that PTLA no doubt would have charged me for the 10 weeks they spent not replying to my request to move. WORST. COMPANY. E V E R. Also, be SUPER suspicious: there used to be reviews dating from back to 2014 here that averaged to 1.2. ~ mysteriously~, they are all gone. Oldest reviews reviews are now a month old or less.

google_reviews.author: Jayme Wilson
google_reviews.review: I have been trying to reach PTLA for a long time now regarding the status of a lease transfer application as well as documentation for ESA. Instead of responding to my emails/phone calls, they deny my upload of the documentation for ESA stating Im not uploading it under the right file identification. The email, if they would respond, that I sent is in regards to this issue and how I am unable to upload it any other way since there is only one area where I can upload any documents. I have called 7 times now and left 2 voicemails with no response as well as an email submission with a complaint. If the office is supposed to be open, all calls should be answered in a timely fashion as well as answered when residents call in the first place. Unacceptable.

google_reviews.author: Adrien Couzens

summary.text:
Good

PTLA Property Management has received some recognition for their efforts in creating a responsive and helpful environment for tenants. According to certain user reviews, some tenants have praised specific employees, like Julian and Jeremy, for their understanding nature and diligence, which contributed to smoother rental processes. This demonstrates the potential for individualized attention within the property management company, highlighting instances where they have provided satisfactory customer service by addressing tenant concerns promptly and professionally.

Additionally, proactive communication from staff members has been noted in a few cases, with some tenants finding PTLA employees attentive to their needs. For example, one tenant expressed gratitude for an employee’s help in transitioning utility services and ensuring a stress-free move-in process. Such reviews indicate that despite the overwhelming dissatisfaction reflected in most feedback, PTLA has had sporadic success in fostering positive relationships and maintaining open lines of communication with a select number of residents.

Great

While the majority of user reviews reveal dissatisfaction, there are instances where PTLA Property Management has excelled and earned commendation from satisfied tenants. One tenant articulated their appreciation for PTLA's support throughout their renting journey, citing respectful and timely responses as key factors that made the experience notably positive. The tenant mentioned feeling supported in a challenging rental market, attributing their comfortable living situation to PTLA's proactive management style. Such feedback highlights PTLA's potential to deliver exceptional service when conditions are aligned with tenant needs.

Moreover, the company has been commended for returning calls promptly and managing tenant expectations effectively in certain situations. Another satisfied tenant noted the clear communication from PTLA representatives when handling their rental inquiries, facilitating a smooth transition between properties. These instances suggest a capability for competence and professionalism, pointing to PTLA's occasional success in providing an accommodating and efficient service experience for select tenants.

Bad

Unfortunately, a significant number of user reviews reflect dissatisfaction with PTLA Property Management, particularly concerning communication and responsiveness. Several tenants reported experiencing prolonged periods without replies to their inquiries, forcing them to take unsatisfactory measures like appearing in person at offices to address urgent issues. This lack of adequate communication has been a recurring problem, frustrating many tenants who expected more timely and direct interaction regarding their housing concerns.

Maintenance issues have also been a point of contention, with several reviews citing delayed or incomplete repairs. Tenants expressed frustration at the slow response to maintenance requests, which left them dealing with problems like non-functional appliances or inadequate heating for extended periods. Furthermore, some users reported experiencing an overwhelming amount of fees and poor transparency regarding billing, which has contributed to a feeling of mistrust and dissatisfaction with the property management's handling of their rental agreements.

Ugly

The ugliest aspects of PTLA Property Management's operations are highlighted by user reviews describing severe negligence and unaddressed safety concerns. Reports of theft, vandalism, and inadequate security measures in certain buildings point to serious oversight in protecting tenants' safety and property. Additionally, experiences of unjustified fees and challenges in recovering security deposits suggest a systematic approach to maximizing revenue, to the detriment of tenants' financial well-being. Some tenants discovered unexpected costs upon move-out, leading to a perception of unfair financial practices.

Moreover, poor living conditions have been reported in several properties managed by PTLA, with issues such as mold, ongoing construction disturbances, and general disrepair making life uncomfortable for residents. Tenants have recounted stress and discomfort due to unmet promises of repairs or improvements, and instances where tenants were moved into unfinished or poorly maintained units have been noted. These experiences paint a distressing picture of a management company struggling with fundamental property management responsibilities, resulting in dissatisfaction and mistrust among a considerable number of its tenants.
